column4: fresh install Ubuntu 5.04, when logging to X computer stops responding after 2seconds. tryed new version of kernel problem the same
can anyone help me?
I had a similar problem a week ago and the reason was that 2 of my RAM sticks were borked
PC ATI Radeon X600, Samsung SATA SP1213c, P4 LGA 1mb/800, 256ddr ,MB Gigabyte GA-8I915P Duo
i have onli one ram stick
I'm not saying that the problem is in your RAM, but it *could* be
but in console my computer works fine
so only your X doesn't work?
i think problem might be in Video card
yes
try to do "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg"
only X and then it starts everithing fine but when i enter login name and password computer stops responding after 2second
and be sure that the refresh rates and resolutions are so that the monitor can handle them
i have cheked them
resolution is fine
and refresh
have you looked in /var/log/Xorg.0.log ?
one minute
my computer stop responding at all i cant jump to another tty and i think its imposible to create error log to se what has happend
well, you should check the log anyway, but after that, I don't have advices on what to do, sorry :-\
